content: corners together try on the sleeve and make sure it is comfortable if it is correct make sure you put wrong sides together and seam up the top of the sleeve you can either do a slip_stitch seam all the way along the top or you can fasten off and use a tapestry needle to use your preferred sewn seam stitch i usually mattress stitch it or whip stitch it then start the pattern over to make the second half of your cardigan make sure your second half is the same size as the first you can easily count the clusters along one edge and match that number joining sides after both sleeves are seamed you can determine if you need to add granny stripe row across your back use a measuring tape to measure your shoulder-to-shoulder measurement for example if your shoulder-to-shoulder measurement is 19 inches lay your two halves of the cardigan flat on a table place this so that your cardigan 4 forms a t shape the two halves should have the back edges touching measure one shoulder to the other you can place the measuring tape at the armpit space and measure to the other armpit space this will tell you how many inches more you need while you are measuring things you also need the gauge of your row per inch this is when you decide how many row of granny stripes you want to add you can either add all the row onto one panel and have an off- center seam or you can divide the stripes in two and add half of them on one panel and half onto the other if you need to add 6 inches more to your back and you are measuring one row per inch you can then know that you need to add 6 row of granny stripe total if you choose to divide this evenly you will add 3 row of granny stripes to each panel on the back side after getting these measurements follow the instructions in the granny stripe section worksheet use this space to write down your specific measurements and numbers shoulder to shoulder or armpit to armpit measurement __________ inches row per inch _________ how many row you need to do rpi x inches = number of row to do= _______ if you want to do a center seam you will take the number of row you need to make and divide it by 2 _______ granny stripe section 1 turn your half cardi so that you are starting on the bottom edge and turn work so that you are working across the work from where it would rest on your lower back up towards the neckline 2 attach your yarn to the right corner and chain 4 skip the three dcs from the row below place 3 dcs in the next chain space and chain one skip the next three dcs from the row below and repeat this across the row
